title: Unresolved names heavily slow down compilation in 2018 edition

labels.name: I-compiletime
labels.description: Problems and improvements with respect to compile times.

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
It occurs when there are lots of unresolved names when, for example, misspelling a commonly used struct name.

For type names [example](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=nightly&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=46c788373818a06fd9f5cae493907bc6). Note that `A` is unresolved.
```rust
type Wtf = (
    // 16 x 8 = 128
    A, A, A, A, A, A, A, A, A, A, A, A, A, A, A, A,
    A, A, A, A, A, A, A, A, A, A, A, A, A, A, A, A,
    A, A, A, A, A, A, A, A, A, A, A, A, A, A, A, A,
    A, A, A, A, A, A, A, A, A, A, A, A, A, A, A, A,
    A, A, A, A, A, A, A, A, A, A, A, A, A, A, A, A,
    A, A, A, A, A, A, A, A, A, A, A, A, A, A, A, A,
    A, A, A, A, A, A, A, A, A, A, A, A, A, A, A, A,
    A, A, A, A, A, A, A, A, A, A, A, A, A, A, A, A,
);
```

Command:
```sh
> rustc +nightly ./name_resolve.rs --edition=2018
... errors omitted ... 12.15s user 0.14s system 99% cpu 12.294 total

> rustc +nightly -Z time-passes ./name_resolve.rs --edition=2018 2>&1 | grep "name resolution"
  time: 11.788; rss: 83MB       name resolution

> rustc +nightly --version                                                                    
rustc 1.35.0-nightly (52e885628 2019-03-15)
```

It can also be reproduced by [unresolved variable names](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=nightly&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=095fcdd6c14e108a67e4a4c4569222e9). It takes about 6.618s in name resolution.

Well, when I specify `--edition=2015` or add definition like `struct A;`, it becomes fast again.
